title: Virtual Director's Talk: James Rondeau
hero_caption: (L) Kehinde Wiley. Barack Obama, 2018. Oil on canvas. © 2018 Kehinde Wiley. (R) Amy Sherald. Michelle LaVaughn Robinson Obama (detail), 2018. Oil on linen. National Portrait Gallery, Smithsonian Institution. The National Portrait Gallery is grateful to the generous donors who made these commissions possible and proudly recognizes them at npg.si.edu/obamaportraitstour.
short_description: Join James Rondeau, President and Eloise W. Martin Director of the Art Institute of Chicago, for a closer look at The Obama Portraits on the inaugural stop of their national tour—the first since the portraits were unveiled at the National Portrait Gallery.
list_description: James Rondeau, shares a closer look at The Obama Portraits. Learn more about how these iconic portraits have garnered national acclaim and their unique resonance with Chicago audiences.
description:
Join James Rondeau, President and Eloise W. Martin Director of the Art Institute of Chicago, for a closer look at The Obama Portraits on the inaugural stop of their national tour—the first since the portraits were unveiled at the National Portrait Gallery. Learn more about how these iconic portraits have garnered national acclaim and their unique resonance with Chicago audiences.

To give you the best experience possible, advance registration is required for this virtual program. Details and instructions on how to join the Zoom meeting will be emailed in advance of the event. 

This program is open to all members of Luminary. To register, email luminary@artic.edu.

Contact Us

If you have questions or are interested in learning more about Luminary membership, we’d be delighted to hear from you. Please contact us at (312) 443-3735 or luminary@artic.edu.

The Obama Portraits Tour is organized by the Smithsonian's National Portrait Gallery, Washington, DC. 

National Sponsor
